page.title: 02Housing
page.content: The majority of houses in Cwmfelinfach are built from sandstone which was dug from quarries on the mountainsides around the village. Most of the houses are{terraced}into long streets,very few are semidetached or detached.The older houses were originally built,about 70 years ago, for miners so that they could live near to the local mine. Nowadays almost all of the houses have been {modernised}to give them hot and cold running water,an indoor toilet and bathroom,none of which were in the houses originally. The miners' houses have the stairs in a straight line with the front door so that an injured miner could be taken to bed on a stretcher very easily. Most houses are owned by the people living in them, only some are rented. 45% of people have moved to Cwm in the last 20years.
